abstract: Dr Stephen M Rich study in journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finds that whole, dried artemisia plants, base ingredient of anti-malarial drug artemisinin, work better to prevent malaria than drug does.
lead_paragraph: The ground-up plants from which the anti-malaria drug artemisinin is derived appear to work better that the drug itself, new research shows.
snippet: The ground-up plants from which the anti-malaria drug artemisinin is derived appear to work better that the drug itself, new research shows.

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Hold the Drug, Go Straight to the Source
